Sakunovāda Sutta：A monk must keep to his own pasture ground，his own native beat （pettikavisaya） - viz．，the four satipatthānas．Objects，sounds，etc．，are passion fraught，inciting to lust．S．v．146f．

The introduction of the sutta contains theSakunagghi Jātaka （q．v．）．The name given in the uddāna of the Samyutta is the Sakunagghi Sutta．
